org.lsmr.vending.hardware

Class CoinChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lsmr.vending.hardware.CoinChannel

  • public final class CoinChannel
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a simple device (like, say, a tube) that allows coins to move between other devices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoinChannel(CoinAcceptor sink)
      Constructs a new coin channel whose output is connected to the indicated sink.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deliver(Coin coin)
      Moves the indicated coin to the sink.
      CoinAcceptor getSink()
      Returns the sink to which this channel is connected.
      boolean hasSpace()
      Returns whether the sink has space for at least one more coin.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoinChannel

        public CoinChannel(CoinAcceptor sink)
        Constructs a new coin channel whose output is connected to the indicated sink.
        Parameters:
        sink - The device at the output end of the channel.

    • Method Detail

      • deliver

        public void deliver(Coin coin)
             throws CapacityExceededException,
                    DisabledException
        Moves the indicated coin to the sink. This method should be called by the source device, and not by an external application.
        Parameters:
        coin - The coin to transport via the channel.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - if the sink has no space for the coin.
        DisabledException - if the sink is currently disabled.

      • hasSpace

        public boolean hasSpace()
        Returns whether the sink has space for at least one more coin.
        Returns:
        true if the channel can accept a coin; false otherwise.

      • getSink

        public CoinAcceptor getSink()
        Returns the sink to which this channel is connected.
        Returns:
        The device at the output end of the device.
